title: Become a Member - Greater Springfield Board of Realtors

contentTree.content:
HOW TO JOIN
Membership Application

To join the GSBOR® there are a few steps you will need to take.

Newly licensed and reinstating Salespersons and Brokers should download the New Member Packet. This packet includes:
An application for Greater Springfield Board of REALTORS® and SOMO MLS (the Regional Multiple Listing Service vendor)
New Designated Broker (DR) MLS Participant Application
FILL OUT OUR FORM
Membership

Membership is granted to all applicants for REALTOR® membership upon submission of the following paperwork (subject to final approval by the Board of Directors of the Greater Springfield Board of REALTORS®):

Ensure your Designated Broker is a member of the Association.
Copy of license/or work permit from the Missouri Real Estate Commission (MREC) and copy of Driver’s License.

*If your license is active at the Missouri Real Estate Commission, under a qualifying broker that holds membership at GSBOR, you have up to 30 days to join from your license active date.*

Complete the correct application form below.
You will be contacted by the Membership Team for next steps.
New Member Applications
Primary Membership Application

If you are a new agent joining Greater Springfield Board of REALTORS® or you are changing Associations and Greater Springfield Board of REALTORS® is your ONLY Association, fill out a primary application. This applies for REALTORS® and Appraisers.

GSBOR Application

Secondary Membership Application
Transfer Membership Application
Appraiser
Rejoining Members
Multiple Listing Service Only Application
Administration-Office Application
Affiliate
Orientation and New Member Code of Ethics Training

You are required to take an Orientation Class along with New Member Code of Ethics Training which are provided free of charge, and must be taken within 60 days of joining the Association. You will receive all necessary registration details for orientation training via email after your application has been processed.

Have a Question About the Application Process?

Fill out a contact form to get more information on membership applications.

CONTACT US

contentTree.html:
How to Join

Membership Application

To join the GSBOR® there are a few steps you will need to take.

Newly licensed and reinstating Salespersons and Brokers should download the New Member Packet. This packet includes:
  • An application for Greater Springfield Board of REALTORS® and SOMO MLS (the Regional Multiple Listing Service vendor)
  • New Designated Broker (DR) MLS Participant Application
Fill out our Form

Membership

Membership is granted to all applicants for REALTOR® membership upon submission of the following paperwork (subject to final approval by the Board of Directors of the Greater Springfield Board of REALTORS®):

Ensure your Designated Broker is a member of the Association.
Copy of license/or work permit from the Missouri Real Estate Commission (MREC) and copy of Driver’s License.

*If your license is active at the Missouri Real Estate Commission, under a qualifying broker that holds membership at GSBOR, you have up to 30 days to join from your license active date.*

Complete the correct application form below.
You will be contacted by the Membership Team for next steps.

New Member Applications

Primary Membership Application

If you are a new agent joining Greater Springfield Board of REALTORS® or you are changing Associations and Greater Springfield Board of REALTORS® is your ONLY Association, fill out a primary application. This applies for REALTORS® and Appraisers.

GSBOR Application

Secondary Membership Application

If you are currently a member with another Association and want to participate in the same great benefits as a Greater Springfield Board of REALTORS® primary member, complete the secondary membership application.

GSBOR Application

*Secondary membership requires a letter of good standing from your primary association

Transfer Membership Application

Transferring from another board of REALTORSⓇ? Fill out an application for transfer here.

GSBOR Application

Appraiser

Joining as a REALTOR® gives Appraisers access to SOMO MLS and Supra keys. This trade name sets you apart from non-members. Proudly display the REALTOR® logo on your marketing literature.

GSBOR Application

Rejoining Members

Agents who have been a member with us or another Board of REALTORS® previously may have varying dues and application fees.  Please email the Membership Department at: support@gsbor.com for additional information.

GSBOR Application

Multiple Listing Service Only Application

MLS Only gives you access to the Southern Missouri Regional® MLS and NO other membership benefits.

MLS Application

If you are the Broker applying for MLS Only access, use the Broker Application.

Broker MLS Application

*MLS Only requires a letter of good standing from your primary association.

(This option is only available to those brokers/agents who already hold Primary Board membership with another Board AND if you are not the Designated Broker, he or she must also be a member of the MLS)

Administration-Office Application

Are you a real estate administrative or office assistant? You can apply for unlicensed access below.

Be aware of the following:

  • Make sure the admin application is signed by the Broker.
  • If an admin holds an active license that is not held with a holding/referral company, he/she will need to join as a REALTOR® member.
  • Know the MREC rules about what an unlicensed assistant can and cannot do when assisting with a real estate transaction.

Administration Application

Affiliate

Greater Springfield Board of REALTORS® Affiliate members are experts in all areas of the real estate industry. There are more than 100 Affiliate members within the Association. Our Affiliates are committed to strong ethical practices, have high professional standards, and provide quality customer satisfaction.

View Affiliate Members

Are you a prospective Affiliate member interested in connecting with more than 2,000 members? Download our Affiliate Application to build your network today

Affiliate Application

Orientation and New Member Code of Ethics Training

You are required to take an Orientation Class along with New Member Code of Ethics Training which are provided free of charge, and must be taken within 60 days of joining the Association. You will receive all necessary registration details for orientation training via email after your application has been processed.

Have a Question About the Application Process?

Fill out a contact form to get more information on membership applications.

Contact Us
